intro: Calcalia alpina, commonly known as the Alpine Calcalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Aizoaceae family. It is native to the high altitudes of southern Africa, particularly in regions like Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability to harsh environments, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
